job.title: Assist a long-time .Net Developer new to Power Pages when stuck
job.description:
I am a developer with 40 years experience, mostly on .Net platform. I have a small consulting company, and a client has asked me to develop a new forms-based site.
I'd like to develop some competency around Power Platform and I'm thinking this is a good fit. I can get up to speed quickly, but I know that there will be gotchas that an expert can help me with in a way that will save me time and money.

Here are a few examples of the type of questions/problems I might have:
- I'd like to have someone look at the overall project description to see if they agree that Power Pages is a good solution and whether they see any hurdles I might run into later.
- I have developed a proof of concept app and am currently working on a multistep form with some subgrids. I don't quite have it working correctly yet and some troubleshooting will help.
- I want to authenticate this app with oauth2, which is not supported. If an applicant has the knowledge regarding this, they could assist with setting up ADB2C for oauth2 with a 3rd party product.
- There will be some workflow associated. If you know flows, that's great, though I could find someone else if need be.

We can communicate by email and/or zoom or Teams.

I expect this to be a couple of hours per week. I'd like to get responses to my questions within 24 hours, but can work around someone's schedule as need be.

Here is a brief description of the project from early on if you'd like to offer any observations as part of your response, though that is not required. 

Thanks for your consideration.

Clients are looking to get certified by submitting a set of forms (5 or 6). A certification is earned when I particular set of forms is approved by admins. (here, a "form" is like a long paper form consisting of many questions).
Some certifications have forms that must be done in order, some can be done in parallel.
Admins provide feedback/comments on submitted forms and refer them back to clients. The comments are added to each question in the form.
Clients revise forms until they are accepted.
Once all required forms are accepted, the certification is earned.
A PDF is created from the final certification forms as a record.

Forms have text boxes, text areas, checkboxes, radio buttons, and tables.
The questions on the form have multiple parts. For example, one question might have two text areas, an array of checkboxes, a set of radio buttons, and a table (tabular data such as lists of contacts).
Tables can have a fixed number of rows. Cells should be able to contain sets of controls (e.g. radio buttons) as well as textboxes.
Not a lot of form logic, though some textboxes are sums of others. Some validation.

A web app is used by clients to manage their side of this.
They log in with SSO from Neon CRM
They can see certifications earned, expirations, etc.
They can see certifications in process and which forms have been started/revised/approved.
They can start a new certification
App should be responsive so it can be used across multiple device sizes

Questions:
	- Is PowerApps a good platform for this?
		○ Power Pages for client-facing part?
		○ Automate for workflow and notifications?
		○ Dataverse for data?
		○ PowerApps or PowerPages for admin functions? If PowerApps, canvas or model-driven?
		○ Will maintenance be easier vs. an asp.net solution? Easier to modify forms/schema/workflow, potentially without developer assistance?
	- Integration with CRM
		○ Want to authenticate with NeonCRM with SSO and access client info from there with little or no replication in the app.
		○ Neon does OAuth2. PowerPages requires OIDC. Best practices for setting up SSO?
		○ Best practice for linking together customer data in CRM and authenticated user data in Dataverse?
	- Forms
		○ Best way to design forms and create schema? Forms are currently paper.
		○ Best way to organize data given it is hierarchical (e.g. forms, questions, tables)? I've made some progress here with a table for the form, tables for use in subgrids as part of questions, a form per question, and multistep form pages. Have not connected schema to users, organizations, workflows, multi-form certifications, etc. yet.

questions.question: Describe your recent experience with similar projects

customFields.generatedDescriptionAI:
We are looking for an experienced Microsoft Power Automate expert to assist a long-time .Net developer who is new to Power Pages. The project is expected to last for 1 to 3 months. 

As the ideal candidate, you should be well-versed in Microsoft Power Automate and have a solid understanding of .Net development. Your main responsibility will be to provide guidance and support to the developer when they encounter challenges with Power Pages. 

To apply for this position, please submit a detailed proposal outlining how you can help with this project. Please include information about your experience with Microsoft Power Automate and any relevant certifications you hold. Additionally, we would appreciate it if you could provide links to past completed projects that showcase your expertise in this field.
